title.narrative: 6.1 NATIONAL NORMATIVE FRAMEWORK

description.narrative: Output 6.1: By 2018, sectoral and cross-sectoral laws, policies, plans, budgets and information systems related to child protection are in line with international norms and treaties, and their implementation is monitored and coordinated, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: By 2018, children and adolescents, particularly the most vulnerable, are better protected against abuse, violence and exploitation.

participating-org.narrative: DREP DOSSO DREP MINISTERE DE LENSEIGNEMENT PRIMAIRE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.1: By 2018, sectoral and cross-sectoral laws, policies, plans, budgets and information systems related to child protectionare in line with international norms and treaties, and their implementation is monitored and coordinated

description.narrative: Taking stock of the current joint programme to ending child marriage, a national strategic plan was developed and validated. the community-based approach in the regions of Maradi, Zinder and Tahoua resulted in the extension of the interventions to 46 out of the 48 targeted municipalities reaching 3856 adolescent girls | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019

title.narrative: % of planned meetings held by the two intersectoral coordination mechanisms at national level (Social action / justice, national multi-sector multi-actor child protection coordination)
Number of national normative texts related to child protection adopted by the National Assembly or Council of Ministers
% of the state budget planned in the CP national policy allocated and expended
Number of social service workers in the country
Data on some forms of violence, exploitation and abuse of children are collected through routine administrative sources
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
Integrated Child Protection Information System operational, with data disaggregated by age and sex
> 80 % implementation of activities in the 2016 workplan for Niger, within the Global Joint programme UNFPA/UNICEF on Child Marriage.
